bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 14, 1897

div1.p: Lazear writes that he has moved to a boarding house.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 14, 1897
div1.p:
Since I
wrote a week ago
two letters have
arrived from you
which I was very
glad to get.

I suppose you
have had relief
from the hot weather
as we have had.
For two days we
have had high
winds.

We are now at
the boarding house.
We have a nice
room facing on the
ocean. The table is
pretty good, well
cooked and served
but a little slim.

The first arrangement
was not satisfactory.

The land-lady was
something horrible, in fact a
typical Yankee, the most horrible
of all creatures.

You have not told me much
about how it is at Miss May's.
As Is the house much crowded.
How is the table?

The Houston's are to arrive
on Saturday. They waited for
the cheap rates to the Christean
Endeavor meeting. They save
a good deal on that way.
